docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Whatever happened to the drug crisis? Last summer, it seized America's attention, stirring a lifeless political campaign. Then it passed on, eclipsed by AIDS, the Iran-contra scandal and air safety. Yet the need for coherent policy endures, beyond public relations spasms. Achieving such a policy requires refining outrage into a recognition that there is no simple answer, no single war; each drug poses its own issues.

headline.main: Which War on Drugs?; Make a Dent by Making Choices
